block.p: The National Basketball Players Association yesterday announced its initiative to feed one million people in Kenya, through its formal partnership with the organization Feed the Children.

The executive director of the players union, Billy Hunter, said at a news conference in Cleveland that members of the union would travel in July to distribute 11 million pounds of rice to drought-stricken communities and schools in Nairobi.
The National Basketball Players Association Wednesday announced its initiative to feed one million people in Kenya, through its formal partnership with the organization Feed the Children.
The National Basketball Players Association yesterday announced its initiative to feed one million people in Kenya, through its formal partnership with the organization Feed the Children.

The executive director of the players union, Billy Hunter, said at a news conference in Cleveland that members of the union would travel in July to distribute 11 million pounds of rice to drought-stricken communities and schools in Nairobi.

''We feel that as our game continues to grow globally, that we have a responsibility to those communities, similar to the communities that we play and reside in now,'' said Derek Fisher, the president of the players union and a point guard for the Utah Jazz.

''When you think about the possibility of being able to feed a million people and the fact that a million people need to be fed is truly amazing. We feel great to be able to have a small part in hopefully changing their lives and having an impact on the world.''
